question: Who of the following said, "On bended knees, I asked for bread and received a stone instead"?
explanation: In the year 1930 (30th January) Gandhiji proposed eleven reforms to the British government. He warned the British if they did not accept his proposal then he would initiate the Civil Disobedience movement by violating the Salt Law. But the British government did not accept it. Then Gandhiji said, \"On bended knees, I asked for bread and received a stone instead\".
